case_title: In re: MEHMOOD ALI KHAN, CHARTERED ACCOUNTANT AND NASIM AKHTER, A.C.A. vs NOT
court: Appellate Bench of Securities and Exchange Commission of Pakistan
respondant: Securities and Exchange Commission of Pakistan (SEC)

accussed_details.name: Mehmood Ali Khan
allegation: Violation of subsection (1) of section 257 of the Companies Ordinance, 1984

accussed_details.name: Nasim Akhter
allegation: Violation of subsection (1) of section 257 of the Companies Ordinance, 1984

complaint_summary: The appellants were accused of violating section 257(1) of the Companies Ordinance, 1984 by improperly signing the auditor's report for Delta Insurance Company Ltd. without proper authorization.
investigation_summary: The Enforcement and Monitoring Division (E&M) of SEC found that the auditor's report was signed by Nasim Akhter, ACA, instead of Mehmood Ali Khan, FCA, the appointed auditor. Show-cause notices were issued, and hearings were held, but the appellants failed to provide satisfactory explanations.
judgment_summary: The court upheld the penalty of Rs. 2,000 imposed by the Executive Director (E&M) on each appellant for contravening section 257(1) of the Companies Ordinance, 1984. The appeal was dismissed, and the matter was referred to the Institute of Chartered Accountants of Pakistan for professional misconduct review.
punishment: Fine of Rs. 2,000 imposed on each appellant.
legal_arguments: Appellants argued that verbal constitution of partnership should be accepted.
Appellants claimed the auditor's report was signed before the AGM date.
Appellants contested the legal authority of the Executive Director (E&M) under section 476(1)(b).
bench_opinion: Appellants not interested in pursuing appeal; excuses deemed invalid.
key_issues: Professional misconduct under Chartered Accountants Ordinance, 1961
key_points: Violation of section 257(1) of Companies Ordinance, 1984 by appellants.
Auditor's report signed by unauthorized individual (Nasim Akhter).
Verbal partnership claim rejected due to lack of legal documentation.
Executive Director (E&M) legally empowered under SEC's S.R.O. No. 230(1)/2001.
Penalty of Rs. 2,000 imposed on each appellant upheld.
Professional misconduct referred to Institute of Chartered Accountants of Pakistan.

legal_terms.Auditor: A person authorized to examine and verify financial accounts.
legal_terms.Professional Misconduct: Behavior that violates the ethical standards of a profession.

words_and_phrases.Verbal Constitution: Formation of a partnership or agreement without written documentation.

summary_vector_notes: The case involves two chartered accountants penalized for improper signing of an auditor's report in violation of section 257(1) of the Companies Ordinance, 1984. The appeal was dismissed, and the penalty upheld. The matter was referred to the Institute of Chartered Accountants of Pakistan for further review of professional misconduct.
